clinical_study.brief_title: Customer Outcomes & Value Experiencing A New Monitoring Technology
clinical_study.official_title: Customer Outcomes & Value Experiencing A New Monitoring Technology

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether novel insight features in new Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMs) can improve glycemic control.

primary_outcome.measure: A1c change from baseline after 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: A1c change from baseline after 12 weeks in subjects using new BGMS compared to subjects' pre-study glycemic control

arm_group.description: Subjects use new LifeScan provided BGMS for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: LifeScan new Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria Summary:
- Diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes mellitus or Type 2 diabetes mellitus for â‰¥ 3 month prior to screening
- Currently performing self-monitoring of blood glucose (SMBG) at home for diabetes management decisions
- Willingness to notify the study staff if they become pregnant during the study
- Willing to sign an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria Summary:
- Currently using a continuous or flash glucose monitoring
- Currently pregnant or planning pregnancy within duration of study or breast feeding; subjects who become pregnant during the study will be withdrawn.
- Conflict of Interest
